skillDescription: Python is a high-level general-purpose programming language. Currently, I use python mainly for my data science projects within Jupyter or Google Colab.
Pandas is an open source data analysis and manipulation tool library, built on top of the Python programming language. I use this library for my data science projects.
NumPy or Numerical Python is an open source Python library for scientific computing. I use this library for my data science projects, and aiming to use it for my future research projects.
Scikit-learn is a machine learning library for the Python that features various classification, regression, and clustering algorithms.
TensorFlow is an pen-source library for machine learning and artificial intelligence. I used Tensorflow particularly on my deep learning projects.
PyTorch is a machine learning framework based on the Torch library, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing.
Tableau is a visualization software mainly used to visualize data and reveal patterns for analysis in business intelligence, making the data more understandable.
R is a programming language for statistical computing and graphics. I use R within R Studio for my data science and statistical research projects.
SPSS is a statistical software suite developed by IBM. I used SPSS mainly for statistical research, advanced analytics, multivariate analysis, and business intelligence
Ms Excel is a well-known powerful spreadsheet editor developed by Microsoft. I particularly enjoy playing with Excel Solver for Optimization problems.
HyperText Markup Language or HTML is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser. It is the basic structure of a website page.
Cascading Style Sheets or CSS is a style sheet language used to give styling for a web page. I prefer using a higher level CSS-based styling, such as Tailwind, Styled-components, or SCSS.
Javascript is a scripting language that enables us to create a dynamic website for better user experience. It is the essential part of a web page, aside from HTML and CSS.

Typescript is an open-source high-level programming language developed by Microsoft that extends Javascript with additional static typing with optional type annotations for a better code and coding experience.

React is an open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on components, developed and maintained by Meta. It is currently the most popular library for front-end development.
React is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on components. It is maintained by Meta and a community of individual developers and companies.
Tailwind CSS is a widely-used open source CSS framework. It enables a rapid styling for modern websites without ever leaving the HTML. Currently, I prefer tailwind over other CSS framework.
Firebase is a set of back-end cloud computing services and application development platforms provided by Google. I use it to store data for my web-dev projects.
MongoDB is a is a NoSQL database program, which is source-available cross-platform and document-oriented. It uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas.
Prisma is a server-side library built for Node.js & TypeScript that helps developers read and write data to the database in an intuitive, efficient and safe way.
Express is a back-end web application framework for building RESTful APIs with Node.js, released as free and open-source software under the MIT License.
PostgreSQL is an open-source relational database management system emphasizing extensibility and SQL compliance.
Node.js is a back-end JavaScript runtime environment, runs on the V8 JavaScript Engine, and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.
Github is a platform and cloud-based service for software development and version control using Git, allowing developers like me to store and manage their code. Visit my github account /yfajrin
Wordpress is a web content management system (CMS). I have used Wordpress for more than 8 years to build several company and e-commerce websites.
Elementor is a visual WordPress website builder that replaces the basic WordPress editor with a live frontend editor, for creating complex layouts visually, and design the website live.
Mailchimp is a marketing automation and email marketing platform. I used Mailchimp mainly for my company's email marketing campaign.
Adobe Photoshop is a raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Inc. I used it mainly for image editing, retouching, creating image compositions, creating mockups, and adding affects.
CorelDRAW is a vector graphics editor developed and marketed by Alludo. I used it to create professional designs with vector illustration, layout, editing, typography, template tools, and more.
Adobe Premiere Pro is a timeline-based and non-linear video editing software application developed by Adobe Inc. It is my go-to software for video editing.
